adventure_overview: The Stronger, Faster, Higher Adventure will help you understand how to eat well,Â  exercise , and the importance of rest . Personal fitness is a balance of these three things. What you eat is what your body is able to turn into energy and can keep your body working to keep you healthy. Exercise not only keeps your body working, it also is good for your mind . Your body needs rest, and so does your mind. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

content.value: With your den or family, plan, cook, and eat a balanced meal.

requirements.text: With your den or family, plan, cook, and eat a balanced meal.

activities.name: Cub Camp Cuisine
activities.description: Cub Scouts prepare a meal on a  pack  campout.

activities.name: Family Feast
activities.description: Cub Scouts plan a meal for a family dinner.

content.value: Be active for 30 minutes with your den or at least one other person in a way that includes both stretching and moving.

requirements.text: Be active for 30 minutes with your den or at least one other person in a way that includes both stretching and moving.

activities.name: Frisbee Frenzy
activities.description: Play a game of ultimate frisbee.

activities.name: Soccer and Scouting
activities.description: Cub Scouts play a game of soccer.

content.value: Be active for 15 minutes doing personal exercises that boost your heart rate, use your muscles, and work on flexibility.

requirements.text: Be active for 15 minutes doing personal exercises that boost your heart rate, use your muscles, and work on flexibility.

activities.name: Fit and Fun
activities.description: Invite a professional trainer to your Cub Scout den meeting to lead a 15-minute activity.

activities.name: Scout Fit Challenge
activities.description: Cub Scouts create a short workout to explore different exercises.

content.value: Do a relaxing activity for 10 minutes.

requirements.text: Do a relaxing activity for 10 minutes.

activities.name: Musical Tranquility
activities.description: Listen to relaxing music to create a calming effect.

activities.name: Trailblazing Trek
activities.description: Go on a walk with your den.

content.value: Review your Scouting America Annual Health and Medical Record with your parent or legal guardian. Discuss your ability to participate in den and pack activities.
